definition: pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
stick/pole/lever/classifier for long objects such as guns

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: The pen is mightier than the sword.
Selected Works of Mao Tse-tung is the classic translation penned by those translators but who were being guarded by gun.
sentences.chinese: 是手里拿着笔杆子背后站着枪杆子逼出来的经典翻译。

sentences.english: You mean your penmanship is good? Is thatit?
sentences.chinese: 你是说笔杆子还行，是吗？

definition: working hand/member of a work team/participant/(short form of 第一把手[di4 yi1 ba3 shou3]) the boss
party affairs/work within the Communist party
soldier (from the two components of the 兵 character) (derog.)
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
lit. to eat from government coffers/to serve as a government employee/to live off government money
